During the holiday, the following items are exempt from sales and use tax:

An item of clothing priced at $75 or less;

An item of school supplies priced at $20 or less; and

To prepare for the start of the 2020-2021 school year, we know there is a lot to consider as you make the best decision for your children as they return to school. We at the New Richmond Exempted Village School District are focused on the planning process for the upcoming school year. Our planning is being done in collaboration with the Clermont County Health Department, Clermont County Schools Superintendents, and feedback from various stakeholders including the members of our Fall Planning Committee.

Unless something drastically changes over the next several weeks, we plan on having in-person school all day, every day for our students. We will also offer an online option for families who do not want to send their children to school in the fall.

The Fall Planning Team is looking very closely at all the things we can do to make our return to school as safe as possible. More details will be shared as they are finalized.

Parents, please watch your email for a second survey from the district. We plan to send something out next week.

post_text: We love good news. We’re happy to share that Locust Corner Elementary School intervention specialist Carlie Fahrnbach is the recipient of the #OhioTORCH Award! Thank you Ohio Department of Education for sharing!
shared_text:
Ohio Department of Education
April 24 at 11:24 PM ·

An advocate, guide and dedicated educator: Congratulations to Carlie Fahrnbach, our fourth #OhioTORCH recipient!

Ms. Fahrnbach, an intervention specialist at Locust Corner Elementary School in the New Richmond Exempted Village School District, nurtures at risk youth and is always available to help students—even outside of school hours and on the weekends. She sees the potential in every student and navigates a path for them to reach success.

The TORCH program signifies Teachers of Ohio Representing Character and Heart, and we're celebrating Carlie Fahrnbach! #OhioLovesTeachers #OhioEd

The history-making NRHS Robotics Team was recognized Feb. 18 by the Board of Education after becoming the first Robotics Team to represent NRHS in a competition.

The team competed Feb. 15 in the VEX Robotics Competition at Milford Junior High School.

They modestly went to the competition hoping to win just one match. Amazingly, the team went 8 and 2 in the qualifying matches catapulting them into the quarter-finals and an unexpected 10th place. A total of 32 teams competed.

Team members are sophomores William Swart, Jordan Shuck, Brandon Gibson, and Charles Stammen. They are all students in NRHS teacher Alan Lindner’s Robotics II class. Mr. Lindner is also the Robotics Team coach.

During the recognition, Mr. Lindner and Robotic Team members talked about the competition and provided a demonstration of their robot.

NRHS celebrates the anniversaries of both of these undefeated teams at halftime of Friday’s basketball game vs. Batavia.

The trophies of both undefeated teams are on display, along with hundreds of other trophies and plaques, at our high school.

Monroe Elementary School first-grade teacher Zachary Stock was recently honored by the New Richmond Board of Education and presented with a Leading Lion award. The award is presented to individuals who go above and beyond expectations in their daily routine

Technology Director Matt Prichard nominated Mr. Stock in recognition of, among other things, his efforts to integrate technology into daily lessons. Through the use of the classroom Chromebooks, Mr. Stock's students learn about various computer applications, coding, and programming, he said.

Mr. Stock also does a “great job of using Twitter and social media to invite parents into the classroom,” Mr. Prichard said. He was instrumental in planning this year’s highly successful family math night.

Later this school year, Stock will be celebrated by InfoOhio for being a leader in technology integration in the classroom. More details about this will be shared as they become available.

post_text: Thank you New Richmond Fire & EMS for all you do to keep our students, community, and schools safe!
shared_text:
New Richmond Fire & EMS
December 24, 2019 at 1:28 PM ·

Did you know that most people who experience cardiac arrest at home, work or in a public place do not survive because they don't receive immediate CPR? New Richmond Fire & EMS was proud to be invited to Mrs. Erin Meranda's health class at New Richmond Middle School last week. Our Director of Public Relations, Cameron Pelzel spent his day there teaching her classes hands only CPR. Hands only CPR is a valuable and easy skill to learn that could potentially save a loved one's life or a complete strangers life. NRFEMS values the relationship we have with the New Richmond Exempted Village School District and very proud we could share our knowledge with Mrs. Erin Meranda's health class!

To learn more about CPR training offered by New Richmond Fire & EMS, visit our website at www.nrfems.org

Introduced several years ago at the urging of Board Member Robert Wooten, Project Lunchbox is a program designed to address hunger in our district. Food is packaged and sent home with students who might otherwise have limited access to food during the weekends and long holiday breaks.

With the support of Gary Slone, the program was launched in New Richmond Schools. It was modeled after the Project Lunchbox program Slone established in Clermont Northeastern Schools.

A community effort powered by local churches is responsible for supplying food to the project. This school year, the task of overseeing the inventory, stocking the shelves and packaging the food for students is the responsibility of New Richmond School District staffers Amy Carey, Sarah Stapleton, and Julie Shepherd. They have strong support from a team of students.

For their willingness to assume program oversight, Amy, Sarah and Julie were each honored by the Board with Leading Lion Awards. They are representative of the many people who power this important program.
